name: seed-cotton production, conventional | seed-cotton | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19743/documentation

This inventory dataset exclusively covers the field activity for the production of 1 kg of seed-cotton in Bangladesh in 2017 for the main cotton variety  known as American Cotton (Gossypium hirsutum).;The production of seed cotton involves inputs of land tillage (fall plow), irrigation (diesel pump), seeds, mineral fertilizers (urea, triple superphosphate potassium salt, limestone, boron, and zinc), pesticides (imidacloprid, emamectin benzoate, and libsen), growth hormones (mepiquat chloride and nitrobenzene) and culminates in harvesting of seed-cotton.  Cotton is planted in mid-July and the plants matures in six months. Cotton plants demand water during the active growth phase and dry weather is needed at maturity as the cotton boll opens. In this dataset, the amount of irrigation needed is included and the irrigation process is covered in a different dataset. At maturity, harvesting is usually done three times and harvesting is completed in mid-January. The yield is 888 kg/acre (2194 kg/ha). The activity for this dataset ends here right after the harvesting operation. The harvested seed-cotton then goes to the ginning process where cotton fibre (lint) and cotton seed get separated. The ginning process is covered in a separate dataset.;;Machineries and fixed overheads are excluded.;Land use change is not accounted in this dataset as seed-cotton area harvested in Bangladesh is shrinking during the period of the last 20 years. Data originate from FAOSTAT.

The activity starts after the harvest of the previous crop and receipt of the inputs of seeds, mineral fertilizers, pesticides, and irrigation water at the field. Machinery and fixed overhead are excluded.

The activity ends at the harvesting of seed-cotton in the field.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0116:Growing of fibre crops

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The data were collected for 2016-2017 cropping season. The same cultivation practice has been practised over the last couple of decades with increased mechanization in tillage and irrigation. In the near future, the scope of changes in the current cultivation paradigm is low. It means that the dataset will remain valid for the next decade or so.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data obtained through field survey and secondary literature.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: If used, extrapolations are documented on the flow level.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Literature data on agricultural practices were taken from the Bangladesh Yearbook of Agricultural Statistics - 2015. The secondary agronomic data were taken from the Cotton Development Board of Bangladesh (http://www.cdb.gov.bd/). To quantify the actual practices in the field, focused group discussions (FGDs) were arranged with the cotton farmers and agricultural extension officers in the major cotton growing districts in Bangladesh. Standardized questionnaires were developed and adapted to cotton-specific cultivation and post-harvest situation. The secondary data from literature and the primary data from surveys were compared and matched to obtain the highest data quality.

Calciulated by using the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production based on data related to the amount of fertilisers and pesticides consumption as obtained through field survey and secondary literature.

Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of seed-cotton is calculated to be circa 5.32E-02 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: 'cyclic N-compound', 'pesticide, unspecified', 'zinc'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.06E-01 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'seed-cotton' is calculated to be circa 3.16E-01 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'lime', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 6.32E-01 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
